1.text: Pick 4-8 healthy apples and remove the stickers.

2.text: Wash and dry your apples thoroughly to clean them off.

3.text: Twist the stems off of each apple by hand.

4.text: Push a wooden skewer or lolly stick into the stalk-end of each apple.

5.text: Lay a sheet of parchment paper out on a sheet pan.

6.text: Fill small bowls with any toppings you plan on adding.

7.text: Heat 0.5 cups (120 mL) of water over medium heat.

8.text: Melt 2 cups (400 g) of golden caster sugar in the water.

9.text: Mix in 4 US tbsp (59 mL) of golden syrup and 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of vinegar.

10.text: Bring the sugary mixture to a rolling boil and simmer for 20 minutes.

11.text: Turn the heat off once the toffee is “hard cracked” at 300 °F (149 °C).

12.text: Tilt the sauce pan up a little and wait for the bubbles to dissipate.

13.text: Dip and twist your first apple into the hot toffee.

14.text: Lift the apple up and let the excess toffee drip back into the pan.

15.text: Lower the toffee apple into any dry toppings you’re using.

16.text: Set the apple down on the parchment with the handle pointing up.

17.text: Repeat this dipping process for each apple you’re making.

18.text: Wait 10-15 minutes for the toffee to cool off and harden before eating.
